title: Champs Elysées (album)
text:
Champs Elysées is the second <a href="studio%20album">studio album</a> by French DJ <a href="Bob%20Sinclar">Bob Sinclar</a>, released in October 2000 on Yellow Productions. It reached number 28 in France and number 94 in Switzerland.
Critical reception.
John Bush of <a href="AllMusic">AllMusic</a> wrote that with the album, Sinclar "proved himself a solid producer despite the lack of freshness, adding in plenty of swooping strings, nickel-bag guitars, and soft-toned keyboards", calling "Got to Be Free" and "Darlin'" "disco-mover productions that wouldn't sound out of place on classic American R&B radio", and concluding that Sinclar "has plenty of fun throughout the LP". Piers Martin of "<a href="NME">NME</a>" was considerably more negative, calling most of "Champs Elysées" "a feeble facsimile" of the "fabled times" of "New York's early-'80s club culture" and the sound of <a href="disco">disco</a>. Martin summarised the album as a "predictable whirl of artificial strings, filtered loops and strident glitterball <a href="House%20music">house</a>", judging that "it's clear Sinclar doesn't have an original idea in his impeccably coiffured head".
Track listing.
Bonus track on some CD versions
French CD and digital bonus tracks
